timeline.bodyText: I wonder whether adding metadata should be a separate task - this strikes me as something users might do independently of publishing a module. We don't have an issue for that just yet, though, so perhaps we can remove these steps from here but keep the content until we do - would that work for you?

+include::../attributes.adoc[]

+* You are logged-in.
+* The module to be published is uploaded.
+
+.Procedure
+
+. Navigate to link:https://pantheon.cee.redhat.com/#/search[].
+
+. Click the name of the module you want to publish.
++
+If you don't see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
+
+. In the list of module versions, click the three verical dots next to the version of the module you want to publish.
+
+. Click *Edit metadata* to add the following publishing details for the module:

replies.bodyText: Indeed, I checked. The metadata persists across sessions, so it seems like adding metadata is a separate task. I've commented out the step to retain the content.
replies.author: theashiot

replies.bodyText: Sorry to jump in here but I 'd like to mention that, a user cannot Publish a module until metadata is successfully added. We might want to  consider adding that as a task/step before clicking on Publish button step to let the users know about the expected workflow. Let me know what do you think?
replies.author: anarang

replies.bodyText:
Thanks @anarang!
@adahms, I wonder whether we expect that metadata is already updated when a user is reading these instructions; in that case I can have "metadata is added for the module" as a prerequisite. Any thoughts Anisha?
replies.author: theashiot

replies.bodyText:
Hey @theashiot - thanks for the callout.
I agree - based on Anisha's description, this sounds like a great candidate for a prerequisite. We'll create modules on actually assigning and updating metadata later on, but for now, calling it out as something that needs to happen sounds good to me.
replies.author: adahms

replies.bodyText:
Hi @anarang,
I added the following pre-requisite to the module:
"The metadata required for publishing has been applied to the module."
Is this ok?
best,
ashwin
replies.author: theashiot

timeline.bodyText: Yes, but we just instructed the user to click 'Publish', so it's too late for this notice. We might create a separate procedure for that, as simple as it might be for now, and include that task as part of a broader user story about preparing content for publication.

@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+include::../attributes.adoc[]

+= Publishing a module in {ProductShortName}
+
+Publish a module in {ProductShortName} to the customer portal.
+
+.Prerequisites
+
+* You are assigned the publisher role in {ProductShortName}.
+* You are logged-in.
+* The module to be published is uploaded.
+
+.Procedure
+
+. Navigate to link:https://pantheon.cee.redhat.com/#/search[].
+
+. Click the name of the module you want to publish.
++
+If you don't see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
+
+. In the list of module versions, click the three verical dots next to the version of the module you want to publish.
+
+. Click *Edit metadata* to add the following publishing details for the module:
++
+* *Product Name* - Select the Product and its Version that the module should be published for.
+* *Document use case* - Select the verb that best describes the module.
+* *Vanity URL fragment* - Enter a URL for the module.
+* *Search keywords* - Enter the words that, when searched by users, should bring up the module in the user's search. This is optional.
+
+* Click *Save*.
+
+. Click *Publish*.
++
+You can preview the module before publishing by clicking `Preview`.

replies.bodyText: Agree, and I see Previewing is a part of https://projects.engineering.redhat.com/browse/FCCEUD-28, so removing from here.

timeline.bodyText:
Although we do have a field for Vanity URL currently, any value that the publisher provides is not yet implemented anywhere in the system - so this is effectively the "future state" of Pantheon, and I'm not sure if the intention here is to document what the system will do "soon/someday."
If we're going for accuracy today, then I would suggest replacing "vanity URL" with "auto-generated UUID."
timeline.author: benradey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+//include::../attributes.adoc[]
+[id="publishing-a-module-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Publishing a module in {ProductShortName}
+
+Publish a module in {ProductShortName} to the {PublishingPortal}.
+
+.Prerequisites
+
+* You are assigned the publisher role in {ProductShortName}.
+* You are logged in.
+* The module to be published has been imported to {ProductShortName}.
+* The metadata required for publishing has been applied to the module.
+
+.Procedure
+
+. Navigate to link:{LinkToSearchPage}[Search page].
+
+. Click the name of the module you want to publish.
++
+If you do not see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
+
+. In the list of module versions, click  *Publish* next to the version of the module you want to publish.
++
+After you publish the module, you can access it at the following URL:
++
+`https://__PRODUCT_URL__/__VANITY_URL_FRAGMENT__`
++
+where, __PRODUCT_URL__ is the URL for the product, and __VANITY_URL_FRAGMENT__ is the vanity URL fragment for the module.

replies.author: adahms

replies.bodyText:
Thanks @benradey and @adahms, changed the text to:
"https://PRODUCT_URL/UUID`
where, PRODUCT_URL is the URL for the product, and UUID is the auto-generated unique identifier for the module. "
what do you think?
